sentences: Ta hoidis oma ema k채est 채ra.
Me hoidsime teist kandidaati v천imalustest eemal.
context: The word 'hoidsin' is the first-person singular past tense form of the Estonian verb 'hoidma', which means 'to hold', 'to keep', or 'to maintain'. It indicates an action that was performed by the speaker in the past. This verb can be used literally (physically holding something) as well as figuratively (maintaining a position, keeping someone away from something, etc.).
